name: Strict TDD Cycle Verification (Kent Beck Style)
expected_behavior: Step 1: Fetches Issue and extracts testable requirements
Step 2: Creates Test List before any implementation
Step 3: For each test in Test List, follows strict RED-GREEN-REFACTOR:
3a. RED: Writes test starting with assert, working backwards
3b. RED: Runs test and observes FAILURE
3c. RED: Reads and understands failure message
3d. GREEN: Chooses strategy based on confidence:
- Fake It: Returns hardcoded value first
- Triangulation: Adds second test to force generalization
3e. GREEN: Writes MINIMAL code to pass the test
3f. GREEN: Runs test and observes PASS
3g. REFACTOR: Applies Tidyings (Guard Clauses, Dead Code, Extract Helper, etc.)
3h. REFACTOR: Runs test after each small change
3i. REFACTOR: If test fails, undoes and takes smaller step
Step 4: Marks test as complete in Test List, picks next test
Step 5: All tests in Test List completed and passing
success_criteria: Test List is created before any implementation begins
No implementation code is written before a test exists for it
Each test is written assert-first (end result, then setup)
Each test is executed and shown to FAIL before implementation begins
Failure message is read and understood before proceeding to GREEN
Implementation strategy is chosen based on confidence level
Fake It strategy uses hardcoded values initially
Triangulation uses multiple tests to force generalization
Implementation is minimal - only enough to pass the current test
Each test is executed and shown to PASS after implementation
Tests are re-run after every small refactoring change
If refactoring breaks tests, changes are undone immediately
Step size adjusts to confidence (smaller when uncertain)
RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle is strictly followed without shortcuts
No test is written that passes immediately without implementation
Tests are never removed (safety net principle)
All requirements from Issue have corresponding tests in Test List
Tidying commits are separated from behavior change commits
